author: M Suganth
title: I hit the gym to overcome the pressure in getting film roles
text:
Actor Vatsan, who was seen in films like Enageyum Eppothum and Apple Penne, will next been seen in Tharkappu, which has Samuthirakani playing a crucial character. Talking about his role, he says, "I play a character with suicidal tendencies, who manages to turn over a new leaf when he falls in love. However, the entry of cops in his life puts him in peril." The actor is also part of Ticket, an English-Tamil horror film directed by TV personality Raghav, which stars Karthik Kumar in the lead.
Vatsan has now developed a six-pack after losing out on a couple of projects. "I had dengue this March and became out of shape. My stamina level had also gone down and I lost two projects during this time. That affected me and I decided that I should get back in shape to overcome the pressure I felt in getting film roles," he says. He hit the gym and for five months, under the watchful eyes of his trainer Kumar Antony, who had trained actor Jai for Valiyavan, he started building his physique. "I started my workouts the 10th day after recovering from dengue. I'm glad that I have been able to get a six-pack without resorting to steroids," he adds.
Now, his new portfolio stills have resulted in audition calls for Bollywood movies and the actor, who grew up in Mumbai, will be leaving for these later this month.
